title: Girls Who Code at UIC Club | Women in Engineering Programs | University of Illinois at Chicago
text: BECOME A GIRLS WHO CODE AT UIC CLUB CLUB MEMBER!

Girls Who Code at UIC Club is a FREE year-round program for 9th-12th grade students in the Chicago-land area who are interested in exploring computer science! Girls Who Code , is a non-profit organization that works to inspire, educate, and equip students with computing skills to pursue 21st century opportunities.
WHEN IS IT?
2019-2020 Program Dates: September 28, 2019 – April 25, 2020
We meet every Saturday, from 10am-12pm, a final schedule of meetings will be provided to participants at a later time.
WHAT ARE THE REQUIREMENTS?
Students must be in 9th-12th grade (or returning participants) and commit to attending all meetings.
IS CODING EXPERIENCE REQUIRED?

Absolutely not! Our Club is open to beginners who do not have any coding or programming experience. In fact, our club consists of 4 different levels to accommodate everyone with or without experience:
Beginner Level covers Scratch and Python
Intermediate Level covers Java Script and Web Development
Advanced Level I and Advanced Level II work on the development of applications and hardware projects using programming
To join, you must apply for admission. Application to our 2020-2021 program will open in April 2020!
PROGRAM LOCATION
University of Illinois at Chicago
Engineering Research Facility
842 West Taylor Street
Chicago, IL 60607
Girls Who Code at UIC is proudly sponsored by UIC Engineering and the following units:
Thank you for your support!
